clinical_study.brief_title: Somatic Mindfulness Training for a Healthy Workforce: Student Pilot Sample
clinical_study.official_title: Somatic Mindfulness Training for a Healthy Workforce: Student Pilot Sample

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study evaluates a somatic mindfulness training. Reductions in mental and physical health correlates of secondary trauma are assessed using a pretest-posttest design.

primary_outcome.time_frame: This outcome measure will be assessed at week 15.
primary_outcome.description: Measures occupational-based secondary traumatic stress using a total scale range of 17(min) to 85 (max). Scores above 37 indicate moderate or higher secondary traumatic stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This outcome measure will be assessed at week 15.
secondary_outcome.description: Measures symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder using a total scale range of 0 (min) to 8 (max), with a score of 33 or higher indicating that participants maybe suffering from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.

arm_group.description: Treatment groups receives the intervention training.

intervention.description: Educational and experiential training to reduce occupational-based secondary trauma.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant must be either employed or volunteering as a victim service provider, or enrolled at Montana State University as an undergraduate student.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is under age 18.
